__e: He said sensors had another use.
The strangest thing, I was in the long-range sensor lab...
We picked them up on our long range scanners. They are headed our way.
We picked them up on our long range scanners. They are headed our way.
- What? You asked me to do a search with the remote sensors.
[FIVE] The array checked out. Everything's fine.
Unless something's wrong with our sensors, we're almost 30,000 light years from where we were.
Speaks right up for something that isn't there, Data.
Now i have the cameras and the motion sensors.
I even have motion-sensor alarms for when I'm gone.
Did your guy tell you they'll probably have motion sensors, too?
My brain is signaling these electro pads to move my arm, and my arms are signaling you to move yours.
I even have motion-sensor alarms for when I'm gone.
He said he knew for a while there was a problem with the pressure sensor.
Sensors show it to be only a mass of energy.
Sensors indicate there was a massive explosion in the room, but when we opened the door, instead of finding charred remains, we found you.
'I'm sorry to have to tell you, but my sensors indicate 'that the Rakweed is not confined merely to this house.'
Sensors indicate there was a massive explosion in the room, but when we opened the door, instead of finding charred remains, we found you.
'I'm sorry to have to tell you, but my sensors indicate 'that the Rakweed is not confined merely to this house.'
Ready. Captain, Iong-range sensors show a Iarge vessel five Iight-years from our current position.
Well, we're out of sensor range and all that, but whether or not we're ready to fight is a whole another story.
Yes, I do, I don't trust the senses. I want to take a look myself.
And according to my armor he's alive.
